statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Savannah State drops to 0-21
article.linkText: Good news, Bears: Baylor hits '03-04 win total
article.story: WACO, Texas (AP) -- Patrick Fields scored 17 points to lead Baylor to an 86-50 win over Savannah State on Thursday. With the victory over winless Savannah State, the Bears (8-4) matched their win total for last season. The Bears opened the second half on an 11-2 run and moved in front 51-26 with 17:30 left to play. Baylor pushed its lead to 30 points at 65-35 with just under 12 minutes remaining. Kevis Shipman and Aaron Bruch each scored 15 points for Baylor while Tim Bush added 11 points and Tommy Swanson 10. Sherrard Reddick paced Savannah State (0-21) with 15 points. Donald Carson and Winston Martinez each contributed 12. Savannah State trailed 7-6 five minutes into the first half as the Bears connected on only one of their first 13 shots. But Aaron Bruce, Patrick Fields, and Tim Bush nailed 3-pointers to key a 13-3 Baylor run and the Bears led 20-9 just over 12 minutes remaining in the first half. Baylor extended its margin to 40-24 at halftime with Fields scoring 12 first-half points. The Bears forced Savannah State into 19 first-half turnovers.
